title: 105_hr1370
content: The Export-Import Bank Act of 1945 is amended to extend authority and funding for tied aid credit and financing for nonlethal defense articles or services with civilian purposes until 2001. SEC. 4 amends procedures for denying credit based on national interest by requiring consultation with specific committees and specifying written determinations to the President of the Bank. SEC. 5 establishes administrative counsel. SEC. 5 amends the Export-Import Bank Act of 1945 to ensure that appropriate legal counsel is available for ethics, conflicts of interest, and administrative law matters. The Export-Import Bank Act of 1945 is amended to promote financial commitments in sub-Saharan Africa and establish an advisory committee to support trade with the region. The advisory committee will advise on policies and programs for 4 years. The advisory committee established under the Export-Import Bank Act of 1945 will terminate 4 years after enactment. The Board of Directors will submit reports to Congress every year on implementing section 2(b)(9)(B) and recommendations from the advisory committee. SEC. 7 amends the Export-Import Bank Act to increase labor representation on the Advisory Committee. SEC. 8 requires the Chairman to implement a program for outreach to companies not participating in Bank programs. Firms demonstrating commitment to reinvestment and job creation in the US will receive preference in financial assistance determinations under the Export-Import Bank Act.
